website_summaries.verdict: With an up-to-date processor and USB port, this modem has a slight edge over some mid-range competitors.
cons: Reliability rating is not as high as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Great modem - can confirm this works with Time Warner and Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I love this modem, it's simple, affordable, and it lasts. I used to have Time Warner, they'll work with this modem. I just moved and switched to Comcast. I can confirm Comcast WILL swear up and down this modem won't work with their service, and try to give you one of their bulky $300 modem/router junkboxes, both the techs and the support reps. This is false, just go to Comcast's online chat and tell the reps you have a Cisco DPC 3008 and not a 3010 (they are both DocSIS 3 and basically the same modem), they provision it, and that worked fine for me. Don't let your ISPs talk you into buying their hardware that you don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martin

customer_reviews.title: Bought a used one and it overheated
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this model back in 2015 used. It lasted until 2019 then it died. 4 years is a good run. I recently bought another used one (same exact model). I plugged it up and noticed it was extremely hot...much hotter than my previous one and I even smelled a strong electrical smell after plugging it in. Long story short, it overheated and died. At least it died quick and didn’t start a fire while asleep.
customer_reviews.author: James Norris

customer_reviews.title: our internet has been amazing. We can have 5 devices linked up and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because Charter Communications was charging us nearly $10/month for their modem (which was more than 10 years old). Our internet connection was unbearably slow and spotty. I purchased this item used, with all of it's cables. After calling up Charter and getting their modem cancelled and ours connected (which took about 30 minutes because of issues they had with our account), we got the modem up and running. After that, our internet has been amazing. We can have 5 devices linked up and running at the same time without slowing down the service unlike before. Very glad that I upgraded and got our own modem instead of leasing from Charter. Very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca N.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for Mediacom internet and Roku!! Purchase router separately! Streaming is the way to go!!
customer_reviews.text: At first, Mediacom said this was an old modem. NOT TRUE!! I bought refurbished for 17 bucks and this is awesome streaming with roku. I will NEVER go back to cable television. You do have to purchase a separate router which is actually stronger wifi. I chose Belkin. I suggest laying this modem on its side(not flat) because it does get warm. I also have a small fan to help. To lease Mediacom equipment is 11 for modem, 15 for the DVR and 5 for each small TiVo.
customer_reviews.author: CS Carnes

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because we now have higher speed that the old modem doesn't support. Paid twelve bucks for this nice used modem. Hooked it up, called media com tech support, gave them the MAC number and after a restart, everything worked like a charm. Speed test proves it! When buying used make sure the modem has been unregistered from the former owner's account or you may not be able to activate it.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. K.

customer_reviews.title: The *joy* of buying used electronics - YMMV
customer_reviews.text: For a mere 15 buckaroos, this used cable modem looked good at first. The seller provided a Netgear power supply (does the voltage output match? does the output mAmp match? good questions!) and a defective Ethernet cable plus no documentation. The surface temperature of the device always shows up in the vicinity of 120 degrees Fahrenheit. Right next to it, my WiFi router shows a 20 degrees cooler temperature. Total crapshoot. Saving grace - it is working so far.
customer_reviews.author: Resident Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap modem you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: It's the best DOCSIS 3 router I found for the price - I got a used one for $25 in December 2014. I've had 25 wireless video streams and torrents uploading at my max bandwidth with no issue, when used in combination with this router I got used at the same time for $15: Used it for 2 years until I switched ISPs to one that included a free modem rental.
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic modem and really cheap
customer_reviews.text: Mediacom had this as a prefered modem after installing a new on at my house. Bought 2 on amazon for about $10 each instead of new prices of 50-100. Mine did quit working correctly today after 6 years after a power outage. Swapped it out with the other and was back to 130mps down and 25up. Never buy the new ones
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Plug-n-Play. Don't let the cable companies tell you that this is not supported, even if it isn't on their approved list. They are trying to push certain modem types because they have deals with the manufacturers. This is a great modem. Give them the MAC ID, have them configure it and forget about it. Lives up to specs. Does run a little hot, but just put it in a well-ventilated space and don't stack it with anything.
customer_reviews.author: Holtsys

customer_reviews.title: works with twc.
customer_reviews.text: This DOES work woth TWC! The first agent told me it was not compatible, when i called again to activate a different more expensive modem the agent informed me that newbies are not aware but the cisco box listed here DOES in fact work. Atleast in NYC. So get this instead of more expensive choices if you have the cheaper internet packages with twc.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeping Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Modem
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get my Ooma telephone service to work properly. It would drop calls or the person on the other end couldn't hear me even though I could hear them. I replaced my modem with this Cisco modem and my Ooma telephone service has worked flawlessly ever since. I was using a Cox cable modem which was a combination internet and telephone modem. (Seems the Cox modem was always trying to locate the telephone but since I no longer had telephone service with Cox, it could never connect.) The moment I replaced the Cox modem with this Cisco model, the Ooma immediately worked perfectly. That's a year ago, and still working perfectly! Excellent modem....excellent price!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for Cox Premiere High-Speed internet service.
customer_reviews.text: Use this with Cox high-speed internet in Arizona. Updated it from my old Motorola surfboard. Setup was a snap. I had a substantial increase in download speeds. (I measured the difference when I got the modem months ago. I do not remember the exact numbers, but I know it increased over 20mbps). I assume my upload speeds increased as well, but I do so little uploading that I have not noticed a difference. Also I experience fewer periods of extremely high latency and/or complete loss of connectivity--but I am not certain this is attributable to the modem (I changed out my wireless router and in-home networking equipment around the same time).
customer_reviews.author: SunDvlAdvocate

customer_reviews.title: Great solid Modem and it is compatible with Comcast Xfinity ...
customer_reviews.text: Great solid Modem and it is compatible with Comcast Xfinity Services. I had to explain to the IT service member that we needed to wait (about 5 mins) for "Packets to be RECEIVED & SENT" (packets are bits of information/communication between client and server) to load properly and then connection was on. Also, for the PC, the local network adapter needed to be reset BY the computer administrator.
customer_reviews.author: rackel mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Cisco has the modem you need 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: 2 years ago I bought this modem after a friend's advice. My Cisco DP3010 is still supplying internet to a busy household. Easy as pie installation, a call to my internet provider,5 minutes later ,,,we were rolling on the web. thank you for a pleasant transaction. T-MO
customer_reviews.author: Tee Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, but not for Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I tried on two occasions to connect this to Comcast. On the first occasion, they could see it in their system and remarked at its amazing speed then apologised because they did not yet have the protocols in place to make it work and would I please try again in a month or so. I did. I got the exact same reaction from the technician; admiration and apology. He put me on hold for a while and then informed me that Comcast had NO PLANS to ever support this model. So, there you are. I'm pretty sure I have had it too long to return, but if you have some other cable company and want a deal on a router....:)
customer_reviews.author: N. Green

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This was initially a good modem. Worked with Cox and was fast. Recently it has gotten to be unusable. We have to unplug it multiple times a day and leave it unplugged. It gets very hot so I believe it must be a heat issue. I am going to have to buy a new modem. And I will guarantee it won't be a Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: mhans311

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Cable modem rental was $10.00 a month from Cox. This modem was on their list of approved docsis 3 modems. The installer said it was old and not as fast as the new modems but it works great and I am getting the full 30 mbps speed I am paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY CISCO
customer_reviews.text: This device failed after 3 months. Though still technically under warranty from CISCO, that only applies if you buy it directly from them. After 4 calls, CISCO directed me LINKSYS who directed me back to CISCO who directed me to another number, I was told I was out of luck. I would not buy another CISCO product as a home user...period.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Datka

customer_reviews.title: So far so great....
customer_reviews.text: I was running the home network on an older Motorola Surfboard DOCSIS 2.0 modem and upgraded to this one. The ISP is Cox Communications in RI and this is one of their approved modems. (Check Cox Comm website for approved modems) My recollection is that speed tests were in the 20/24Mbps Download & 1/1.5Mbps Upload range. After the upgrade I am consistently getting in the 35Mbps Download range(50% increase). Upload speed has varied from 4Mbps to 9Mbps(300%-800% increase). It's only the first couple of days but... if this continues, this is a DEFINITE winner.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Model DPC3010 Modem
customer_reviews.text: Decided i had enough with renting fees from Time Warner Cable and bought this. You can get them used for only about $30 from amazon so why would you keep paying renting fees? Anyways this modem was not on the approved list of compatible modems for TWC but they activated it with no problem. Just had to call them up, provide my MAC, and reset my router and now I am enjoying incredibly fast speeds at the new DOCSIS 3.0. The router came well packaged and looked brand new (even though i bought a used one) and there wasn't a single scratch or scuff on it.
customer_reviews.author: Makivante

customer_reviews.title: Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I would put a zero instead of one if there was an option. Just bought and installed this in September, yesterday it died. Sucks.
customer_reviews.author: connie hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well For A While...
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for 4 months but then started overheating where I have to unplug every so often - which after 5 months became once a day. Quite a few of the reviews for this product said customer support is bad or not existent so I'm ordering a Netgear and not going to by Cisco anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Almost Silent

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have COX service in SoCal, and decided to purchase a modem to avoid the $7/mo rental fee. I had no setup issues, and haven't had to reset it once in the 2 months I've had it. I've actually been getting higher upload and download speeds than I pay for (2nd highest tier) most of the time, and get picked as the host frequently when playing on Xbox Live. This is a nice little modem, and I wouldn't change anything about it. Pros: Compact Works VERY Well Black, unobtrusive Cons: None yet
customer_reviews.author: Opinions

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs manual resets constantly if your ISP's connection is unstable
customer_reviews.text: Works well until your connection briefly drops and then you need to do a manual reset. I bought a Motorola modem and just yesterday my connection dropped and the router reset itself in less than 10-15 seconds! My Netflix show paused and resumed by itself after connection was re-established. Trust me it is really nice not having to unplug everything for 30 seconds and power back on. Something else to consider, If you have network cameras you can't do manual resets of your modem while away.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Simple, nicely built, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the old DOCSIS 2.0 Network for a couple of years, my cable company has been bugging me to upgrade, I finally looked into the difference and it has definitely helped to speed up my network, nothing major. About an extra 20 kilobytes per sec for downloads and 10 for uploads. I picked up my modem barely used and saved quite a bit and recommend you do the same, seems to be a lot of Comcast customers that have purchased this modem and it is not compatible with their network. Just check to make sure your cable company can support this first.
customer_reviews.author: Zephaniah Harrington

customer_reviews.title: The modem is identical to the one that the cable company was renting me.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this modem for years without issue. I decided to buy rather than rent. The modems speed is consistent with the speed purchased from cable company.
customer_reviews.author: South Dakota

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year of Use : No Power-Cycling Needed
customer_reviews.text: I called Charter and added this DPC3010's MAC address to my account. Within minutes it was connected and speedtest.net showed 21ms ping / 108 mbps down / 5.8 mbps up. I have never had to reset this modem to restore its connection once in the year I've owned it. Not having to pay $7/month to lease a modem made this pay for itself within 8 months. It doesn't emit much heat, it makes absolutely no noise, the lights aren't obnoxiously bright at night if placed in a bedroom, just overall a great product. Feels quality built when handling and obviously has quality internals. I recommend this if you need a DOCSIS 3 cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy works fine for speeds UpTo 105Mbps
customer_reviews.text: Bought used modern from Amazon works fine . In starting when plugged in had few performance problems as it was losing connection but after unplugging and replugging few times seems to be working ok from almost month now. Internet connection signal link light blinks very fast compares to the new router i was using provided by internet provider, all in all if this keeps working like this, I'm a happy customer if stops working I will update my review. I recommend this buy to others...
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Many months of problem free service
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a single issue with this cable modem. Just what anyone would want it their home internet installation. I use Cox as my ISP, and it was on their approved device list. I recommend to anyone needing a cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Look da rice

customer_reviews.title: It was junk
customer_reviews.text: This unit was made 10 years. They are only good for 5 years. Had error codes one after another. It was junk
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Kocialski

customer_reviews.title: this it not brand new
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised and sold as a new item but it is not this is a refurbished item at a premium price. this is very disappointing the router came with the old apartment complex information listed on the box and modem . The it is not a good modem at all you have to reset it everyday and the connection is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: bjs

customer_reviews.title: I'd be even more annoyed.
customer_reviews.text: It was flawless for 2 years and five months, and then just died. No lights would turn on even though the thing was plugged in. Straight up flat out died. I searched really hard (google, amazon, cisco site, cisco site's warranty finder, read the product's pdf) and saw that there was no warranty information except for cisco's standard 90 day warranty. I realize I'm out of any warranty period anyway (other modems I've seen have a 2 yr warranty max). But if this HAD died within 2 years, I'd be even more annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: g.unit

customer_reviews.title: This modem will pay for itself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as soon as Time Warner started charging a lease fee for their modems. Only an idiot would pay $5/month to lease a modem when they can simply buy a used modem like this for $25. Yes, I bought a used one on Amazon since new was 3x the cost for an item that normally lasts for many years. Works perfectly and Time Warner didn't give me any hassle swapping this in, even though it wasn't on their "acceptable" list at the time (it may be now, I've never checked). This modem has more than paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Nitrousbird

customer_reviews.title: Functional & Automated
customer_reviews.text: I recently got Cox internet, and instead of paying "rent" for their modem, I bought this modem. It works very well; it's fast and reliable. It auto configures based on whether it has an active cable connection. At first it issues DHCP leases so you can see its status and troubleshoot problems. If it connects to the ISP successfully, it drops the IP and gives your router the public IP address. Simple
customer_reviews.author: C Goodweather

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good as the cable company version
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as the cable company version. Cox decided to charge me monthly for theirs, since I dropped the tv and phone and kept only internet. I found over the air digital tv clearer and saved a lot of money. This box paid for itself in three months and is in excellent condition. It is a cable box, doesn't get a lot of wear and tear, so I opted for a used one and saved even more money. I stream movies and video on multiple devices, my son plays video games online as well. This modem is a 8X4 channel so it is ready for any future speed increases.
customer_reviews.author: cptcoolie

customer_reviews.title: Used with Cox (Ultimate) in Scottsdale
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the piece of crap Netgear that Cox gave me in Scottsdale, AZ -- I have the Ultimate service that just recently (yesterday) got upgraded from 65mbps to 150mbps -- speedtest.net shows 100mbps -- I don't know if I am capped due to the modem or if the cable company is under-delivering. Overall I'm super happy with the extra speed, so probably won't dig too deep on that, as far as I can tell this is DOCSIS 3.0 compliant and I have been really happy with it. Never dropped the connection and always fast (we stream everything in HD).
customer_reviews.author: Riyad Kalla

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable modem!!
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play and always works!! I have Cox cable and did not want to pay rental fees so I researched a little found this to be compatible to Cox. You will have to call Cox to register your modem but that was real easy and just worked.
customer_reviews.author: skider

customer_reviews.title: DPC3010 recycled modem works great !
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Was able to replace the existing leased modem/router/wireless with this purchased, recycled modem/router. There already was a separate wireless broadcaster (WAP) on site that I plugged into this DPC3010 to continue wireless service. All I had to do was give the Internet Provider the MAC address and within 15 minutes it was fully activated. Well worth the price !
customer_reviews.author: John Lorens

customer_reviews.title: Works with Suddenlink - 108mbps Down
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the Cisco DPC3010 DOCSIS 3.0 - The unit was up and running on a new install from Suddenlink. It tested right out of the box @108mbps down and 8+mbps up on my laptop . Got what I paid for as far as bandwidth. It runs a little warm. Hopefully this is not a problem later on. Works with my Cisco 2851 router. I have let the Cisco router completely boot and then boot the modem. It seems the modem gives up offering DHCP after a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: PokerFace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative Modem
customer_reviews.text: Needed to upgrade my cable modem to a newer software / hardware model. The options offered by my cable company were way to expensive and lower-end products. This unit offered me a higher-end and reasonably priced alternative. Installation and activation through my cable company was a breeze and we immediately noticed a difference in our internet access speeds. Would certainly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: RandyJ

customer_reviews.title: Standard Reliable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I have had this modem for years and never had any problems. This is a great standard modem, very easy setup with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: All I had to do was replace the old DOCSIS 2 Modem with this one, register it as 'new' on-line with Cox Cable (had to give ser. no.) and I was done. With a product like this I don't have metrics to know how this improves things, however I can say I no longer have to wait for my PC to buffer HD video. It streams in real time. It's been running for a few months with no issues. BTW - my PC has 16GB RAM and an Intel 3.4 GHz processor running Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead, it works!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, no heat, and best of all, no more rental fee from Time Warner. I had to get bounced from one support person to another to get the MAC address setup and working, but once they entered it into the system, it worked perfectly. I own other Cisco equipment because I trust the brand, and expect this modem will be as reliable as SurfBoard POS I paid for ten times over in rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherAmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaoer than rent from cable co.
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I wouldn't have to rent one from my cable company. It's a nice product and its what they would have had my using but renting from them instead. It was very simple to setup, and it works for my speed plus it can allow faster connections still
customer_reviews.author: Calaeb H.

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. The modem had previously been provisioned for Cox ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used DPC3010 to replace my RCN-supplied modem, and it works great. The modem had previously been provisioned for Cox (based on the installed firmware), and I was setting it up for RCN. Setup was straightforward - plug everything in (computer directly into modem instead of via router). Turn it all on, open up the modem's web page, and wait a really long time (5 min) for it to figure out how to talk to RCN's network. Once it connected, RCN has a nice web interface for activating the modem. It's only been a day, but it's working flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Used this to upgrade my Motorola Surfboard DOCSIS 2.0 cable modem. Works great with Midcontinent cable in the midwest. This is actually the cable modem that they will sell you if you ask for one without wifi. Make sure to check with your ISP to see if this is compatible as I have heard of a couple of them that don't accept this model. So far no problems with it and seems to have help speed up my connection a bit (2 months of use as of the time of writing this) and thus the 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Gyrating Panda

customer_reviews.title: Great router to get the routing done
customer_reviews.text: Great router for a family who isn't as demanding of the internet. If you have a larger household that many people are hitting the internet, you might want to consider something with a little more 'umph. Overall, it is a great router to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gabel

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Modem & Money-Saver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for the "pay rent on forever" model that you are given by your ISP. Saved me $5.00/mo from Time Warner Cable. You have to call to get it activated (which, with TWC's customer service, is barely worth saving $5.00/mo) and they will tell you it isn't one of their "approved" replacement models, but tell them to do it anyways and it works like a charm. Significantly better speed (and user-management) than the trash the cable company gives you. Well worth it; Cisco makes a quality, low-profile product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just a note to some people.
customer_reviews.text: runs well for Cox. I bought this to replace my DOCSIS 2.0 modem because the Preferred package increase speed from 25M to 50M. After calling Cox and setting the modem up, the max speed is around 25M. I did some research and it was Cox's problem. So I called Cox again saying that the speed is not correct. They fixed it in 15 min. So now it is working fine. Max speed is 58M - because of Cox's speed-boost technology. When stable, 50M.
customer_reviews.author: H. Yan

customer_reviews.title: Smart and easy-handle DOCSIS 3.0 modem, works excellent on Time Warner Cable Internet service.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it works excellent with Time Warner Cable internet service in Lincoln, Nebraska. All I need to do is just to call Time Warner Cable and told them the MAC address of modem. Internet connection is very good without drop line. Besides, its small size make itself easy to place in room. Overall, I purchased a used item for only $17.95, a charming price for a smart and easy-handl DOCSIS 3.0 modem. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SeanMa

customer_reviews.title: easy to manage router
customer_reviews.text: At first I had some issues with the router dropping signal or just low signal throughout the house. I went to the Cisco site and found out how to adjust the channels for WiFi. When I first got it I went through and set everything up for auto which would be good if I had more space between my neighbors. The web interface id easy and give you enough information to manage the router. I love the guest account feature which allows you to share your WiFi with guests without sharing any of your files.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Valdez

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets!
customer_reviews.text: Although I did eventually have to call Cox cable to re-activate this replacement modem, its installation was otherwise flawless, and the thing has greatly improved my internet experience. My other modem was 8 years old and either it or the router would kick off at least once a day leading to endless grief and re-booting. Haven't had a lick of aggravation since replacing it with this gem.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap buy
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap buy! Instead of paying $8 to rent a modem I bought one for $15. I called time warner and they helped with the installation. I have basic Internet and it works great with that option but I'm not sure how it does with high speeds. Although it is not on the time warner list of modems, this Cisco model works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem, Won't work easily with COMCAST.
customer_reviews.text: The modem would have worked great but I couldn't convince Comcast customer service that it was the same thing as the DPC3008(it just has a USB port). Untimely I had to return it but it was not the products fault. If you get the "right" customer service agent they can make it work but it is probably not worth your while. My real issue was that the line was not hooked up with the street and Comcast's poor customer service said it was and that they couldn't provision this modem.
customer_reviews.author: kms254

customer_reviews.title: Works with cox don't let them tell your otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. Definitely compatible with cox don't let them tell you otherwise. I did have a little bit of trouble starting the activation online, but after a 45 min phone call with cox support they got it working. I was a little naughty and told them i got it from the cox solution store, but they didn't call me out on it. Got to love the end result though. I dropped off their crappy rental modem at a cox store and now this thing will pay for itself in two months.
customer_reviews.author: Gammapack

customer_reviews.title: Works for me on Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from NetBetShop on Tuesday. Delivered on Thursday. I am in South Carolina and they shipped from Maryland, so that helped. Hooked it up and called Spectrum. They asked for the MAC address and within 20 seconds he remotely rebooted my modem and it started working within another 30 seconds. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tom E. Boy

customer_reviews.title: Reboot It Weekly
customer_reviews.text: I have to reboot it weekly. Not sure if it is my ISP or this modem. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: The first time I connected it with the router, ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I connected it with the router, I had no Internet access. But the second time by the same connection and setting approach, it works. There is no instruction book in the package, which made me confused to use this modem. I am unsatisfied with this point, although it is compatible with COX and my TP-link router.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Works great and consistant
customer_reviews.text: I had a old cable modem for about 8 years and it was dieing. I thought it was my router as devices would lose their IP addresses. Turns out that when the router lost its WAN link it dropped the switch connections as well, which is odd, but a fact. I replaced the modem with this one, called Cox Cable and they did their magic (took about 20 min) and I was up and running. Speeds are accurate to what I was paying for so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedD408

customer_reviews.title: Long term - maybe not...
customer_reviews.text: It WAS working quite well and then... the lights all started blinking so I did a full re-set of the system. Only the modem would NOT turn back on so now I'm left with no internet and need to buy a new modem. I only got this one in February 2015 so it is not that old!
customer_reviews.author: AZ Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: I got this modem to replace my old Linksys cable modem, because it couldn't handle the upgraded speed change by Cox. My old modem topped out at 15mbps. This Cisco modem works perfectly! Set up was a breeze and it worked perfectly from the start. I now get 32mbps down and 20mbps up. A great modem and at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Mediacom
customer_reviews.text: I ended up getting this for our new Mediacom account and it works great! The upload speeds we get are even more than we "should" be getting according to the account we have setup. As for download speeds, we ended up going with the 100mb account and I think I have seen this thing get speeds of 112mb via a speedtest. Working as good as I could ask it to.
customer_reviews.author: croman

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Model DPC3010 DOCSIS 3.0 8x4 Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: This modem works on my Metrocast cable system (approved model). It's been running for over month without incident. At $5 a month for a rental modem, It was really a no-brainer to try this and save myself a few bucks. A new modem from Motorola is $60 to $90, so you can do the math for yourself. Just be sure to check if it is compatible with you service providers system.
customer_reviews.author: Pa user

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: A nice improvement over the DOCSIS 2.0 version. Internet speeds picked back up to the 100% of the ISP allowance. The 2.0 version gave me about 1/2. If using Cox call them up to get it activated. Their instructions to do it online don't work. You'll need to give them the S/N and MAC address, which are found on the product label.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony(RI)

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, and it was CHEAP for a Docsis 3.0 Modem
customer_reviews.text: Showed as being active on someone's account in Arizona, so that created some issues with activating on my service. It took Cox 24 hours to find out what company it came from, have that company release the serial and MAC, then reactivate it for me. That being said, it DOES work well. I'm on a 25mb package, and now am getting consistently 30-35MB down, 10-12MB up. Not too shabby for just a bit of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Drivenlegend

customer_reviews.title: Cable Modem is OK but won't work for SureWest
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get rid of the monthly charge for my cable modem so I bought this. It was the identical model to the one from SureWest and even came out of the same factory. None of that mattered. SureWest does not/will not push out the firmware for their system. The configure their modems at their locale. It took about 2 hours and 3 different levels of customer service people to find this out. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations for really cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a year and half now with Time Warner Cable. I also have one running at my in-law's house. Tech support says it's not compatible but works extremely well. I pay for 50Mbps/5Mbps but consistently get more than that (screen shot attached). Not only has the modem not dissappointed but neither has Deal Time Plus. This is what I recommend to friends looking to stop leasing their modem from TWC for really cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable!
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Linksys products only I decided to look elsewhere when I started to have problems. Not only does my cable company support this fast modem but I never have the problems of it rebooting itself or dropping a signal as I did with others before. I've thought about buying another for a backup I'm so happy with it but am hoping this one will last a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: celinenme

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - documentation is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The product came packaged nicely and was delivered promptly. When I opened the box, the instructions are a bit light in the details department because they do not specify the colors of LED's if you are trying to troubleshoot any issues. Once I called my ISP, the setup went quickly and was done within minutes. I was replacing an old gateway device that I had used for the last 10 years and this product is performing flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shook

customer_reviews.title: Used Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: We have RCN in the Boston area with 110/15 MBs service. Various speed tests consistently show that we get at least our rated download/upload speeds. Setup with RCN was relatively easy. I read elsewhere that modems tend to last. If they work initially, they will keep working. I've been happy with this used/refurbished purchase. Return on investment is only 3 months. I've only had this modem for a few weeks. Hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cox Communications Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the web based guide to setup the modem through Cox so I had to call them but it works just fine and it is hard to beat for $18! If you have a problem with the amber link blinking then try power cycling the modem after you are off the phone with Cox. I had this problem and once the modem did another sync I had all solid green lights.
customer_reviews.author: Sociologist

customer_reviews.title: No more TWC rental fee.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of paying the fee for my cable modem. It is better hand I had hoped for. Due to it's multi-channel capabilities my downloads are faster and my upload speed has doubled. The online speed tests DO NOT reflect the true speed of this modem, I used streaming video load times as my benchmark. Download speed is at least 2x faster, without increasing my TWC roadrunner speed. I pay for 20 mbps down, online tests say 18 mbps, actual speed is much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Petit

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mediacom in Iowa (Nov 2015) 50Mbps down
customer_reviews.text: The product works well with Mediacom cable service (50Mbps down) in Iowa as of November 2015. It dissipates heat very well and I have not had any network disruptions thus far in 1 months of continuous usage. I occasionally get around 60Mbps down with this unit. Make sure to check compatibility with your current for future ISP by visiting the following website:
customer_reviews.author: Shun

customer_reviews.title: The price is perfect (even though it is refurbished I would not let ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this modem for over 2 years and I almost never have to restart it. I would suggest this model to anyone with cox service. This was actually for a friend of mine who never got on the D0CSIS 3.0 bandwagon. The price is perfect (even though it is refurbished I would not let that make you think it would be a bad thing)
customer_reviews.author: K. Siler

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Time-Warner Cable/Roadrunner
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this last night, and I called Time-Warner Cable to get it set up. It works perfectly. The representative on the phone did not ask the brand or model number of the modem; she only asked for the MAC address number. So even though this is not on Time-Warner Cable's approved modem list, it will work. (At least it will work with TWC in South Carolina.) And since you can pick it up used a lot cheaper than the Motorolas I think this is the way to go. (I would not be surprised to see this on Time-Warner's approved modem list before long.)
customer_reviews.author: M. Ed.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - increased speed too.
customer_reviews.text: Cable company had been rolling out DOCSIS 3.0 for over a year. I was not sure if this would help me - middle tier user. But quite surprised that the 8x4 channels really do help. Now I am actually getting to my PC the service that I pay my cable company for. Cisco has always been my vendor of choice - would recommend you consider DOCSIS 3.0 as well. Very happy customer and user.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works with time warner.
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself a ton of money and buy a used one. I did. $25 and now I can send my leased modem back to time warner. This will pay for itself in 4 months ($6.99 a month to lease from the provider!). And yes, it works perfectly with time warner. So if you are concerned about that, don't be.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great for price but...
customer_reviews.text: There was a major security flaw that was released publicly and never patched due to lifecycle and cost issues. That said, I own 2.
customer_reviews.author: Les S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Comcast in Fort Lauderdale but....
customer_reviews.text: It was an ordeal I have to admit ,Spoke with 3 'techs' , was promised a level 2 tech would call 24-73 hours but never happened then I said get me a supervisor , She worked on it for an hour , had to talk to other groups but then pow ! I was online. My suggestion give the 'Tech' one try then say I want to talk to your supervisor. PS it was a used modem and had a cox.bin firmware, but after comcast go it to work it had a comcast.bin firmware.
customer_reviews.author: F. D DENTON

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and easy
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this up for my provider, Cox Cable Las Vegas, after looking at their list of compatible modems. This one works perfectly, and they had no problem getting it registered on their network after giving them the S/N on the bottom of the modem. It's been working flawlessly for a 30Mbps download-side service. It connected into a linksys/cisco 4 port router also with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Allen E. Nance

customer_reviews.title: Setup was every easy just connected it to my router and the incoming ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was every easy just connected it to my router and the incoming cable line, plugged it in and called my cable provider. I was set up, activated and cruising the internet within 30 minutes.Modem works great getting the full amount of the internet speed that I am paying four on 4 computers without a problem. I would highly recommend this cable modem to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for Cox Communications Internet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cisco DPC3010 Cable Modem to use with my Cox Communications internet connection. The setup was easy and there are no connection issues caused by the cable modem so far. If you are installing the modem yourself without the help of an onsite Cox specialist make sure you call Cox internet tech support to validate the MAC address for proper setup.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Looking good, but not working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my internet connection. Everything looks fine in the box, until the technician guy connects it to the cable. It's not working at all. They try to reset it several times, but no use. After all, I have to buy another modem from the server. I'm not sure it doesn't work because of itself or the cable company doesn't connect to the modem that not theirs. I return this item anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Y. N. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Modem upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This is in use now. Had to upgrade a while back to DOSCIS 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Demyan

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought Nov 2015. At the end of Feb, had intermittent internet issues. After a long while troubleshooting with the local ISP (and their annoying automated service), it was shown that the modem was having issues. I replaced it with an old surfboard modem (which can't get the bandwidth we ordered with our ISP) and the old modem is working. When the Cisco modem is turned on and the ISP sends out a signal, the modem lights just cycles over and over again and hangs....never sending a signal back. Anyway, wasted money on this. It may just have been one in a few and I got the bad one, but just letting everyone know.
customer_reviews.author: Dbo

customer_reviews.title: I got this for a great price on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a great price on Amazon. It's small and fits anywhere. It gives me VERY fast speeds compared to my old DOCSIS 2.0 modem. It is plug and play. I do not have another one to compare it to except my old Motorola Surf Board. This modem is better than that old thing mainly because of it's small size.
customer_reviews.author: Walter MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Buy This One Used
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these used because they are much cheaper that way. It's a cable modem... it either works or doesn't work, so used is A-OK. This had 8 channels down and 4 channels up so it can handle very fast speeds. I get 100MBPS at my house and this keeps up with it just fine. I will keep buying this model again and again for friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem for Cox Communications
customer_reviews.text: Used this modem to replace my old Cisco DPC3000. I have absolutely no complaints. It's faster, runs cooler and does its job! It's compatible with Cox Communications.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on Cox
customer_reviews.text: Got this in response to a message from our Internet provider (Cox) that we should upgrade to DOCSIS 3.0 for better speeds. The upgrade was painless; just had to swap the new modem in for the old one and then call customer support with the barcode numbers printed on the package (also on unit bottom). They activated it within 5 minutes and it's been fine ever since.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent with Cox Communications!
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautifully with Cox Communications and is on their approved modem list. Had to buy a wireless router separate, but I like it better this way. This is miles better than buying or renting a modem with Cox. According to Cox themselves, this modem is compatible up to the Ultimate Tier of their internet service.
customer_reviews.author: Lants

customer_reviews.title: Just another crappy product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. I have had this product almost 6 months to the day and now it is dead. I've tried plugging in different outlets, I've tried different chords and nothing works. So now I'm screwed. Thank you technology for failing again.
customer_reviews.author: Alycia Calvert

customer_reviews.title: Great modem!
customer_reviews.text: Kinda out of date now. Just died after almost 4 years. Still beats paying the cable company for a modem
customer_reviews.author: J Stan

customer_reviews.title: No big fight with my isp
customer_reviews.text: I asked my isp (rcn) and all they said was it had to be docsis is 3.0. Nevertheless, I was prepping for a fight that thankfully never happened--the tech installed it and my bill dropped $5 a month. There's a number to call if your isp gives you trouble; I don't know how that would go since I didn't have to call.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECT with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Works PERFECT with Comcast. Just tell them it's a DPC3008 and you'll have zero problems hooking it up. Works flawlessly with my netgear wireless router. Very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: captain america

customer_reviews.title: Great modem if your cable provider officially supports it.
customer_reviews.text: This modem works great for Cox Cable. Just don't buy it if its not officially on your providers supported list. A few people have gotten some techs with Comcast, etc to activate it off the books when its not supported, but that is like playing russian roulette and the odds are it will be a paper weight. Its great with Cox who supports it though.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It's fast, easy enough to set up and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the headline says, it's fast, easy to set up and reliable. I am one of those guys that pretty much just wants to set it up and then want's to basically forget it and let it just run and do it's job. If you're like that...this will work well for you. If your one of the techie types that wants to babysit the thing all the time and have cool reports and dashboards, well...I could see at a glance that you could have fun that way too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff_Brown_QC

customer_reviews.title: Really good Modem. Read Description.
customer_reviews.text: So I've been using this modem for awhile and I only had an issue, the modem would shut off at random times. The solution? I changed the charger.... apparently the one that came with it wasn't supplying enough juice. after using the new charger I havent had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: DonArcadio

customer_reviews.title: Cox Cable sucks, but this modem makes it more tolerable.
customer_reviews.text: The old modem was slow and disruptive to all of our wifi enabled devices. This modem keeps us online and I found out that cox will upgrade your speed for free if you get a DOCSIS modem, of course they would never tell their customers such useful information.
customer_reviews.author: S.Will

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend this cable modem. My first criteria was the brand & since Cisco has a good reputation, I considered their products. This model has performed up to my expectations & the speed it delivers was what I expected. I'm a havy user of streaming stock charts with multiple windows opened at any given time. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: TurboTiger

customer_reviews.title: 0 netgear router( last gen) and they went together fine! save your$ dont use the IP providers stuff- ...
customer_reviews.text: backwards compatible-bought 3.0 netgear router( last gen) and they went together fine! save your$ dont use the IP providers stuff- buy your own! as this does run a little hot I put extra rubber 'legs' under it for more airflow- but its a good product!
customer_reviews.author: redsox

product_meta.title: Cisco DPC3010 DOCSIS 3.0 8x4 Cable Modem
product_meta.description: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH COMCAST! Welcome to the exciting world of high-speed Internet access. You have acquired one of the fastest cable modems available on the market today. Your new Cisco Model DPC3010 Cable Modem offers high-end performance and superb reliability at data rates up to eight times that of conventional DOCSIS 2.0 (DPC3010) cable modems. With your new DPC3010, your Internet enjoyment, home and business communications, and personal and business productivity will surely soar. Brown OEM Box Cisco Model DPC3010 DOCSIS 3.0 8x4 Cable Modem Cisco DPC3010 comes in Original Cisco Brown OEM Box, CD, Manual, USB cable, Ethernet cable and Power supply. Cisco DPC3010 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem. P/N 4027668Cable ModemUSB 2.0, GigE portF-type RF connector, female, 75ohmThis unit has been previously used and shows some cosmetic wear. It will come alone without a power cable/adapter, or accessories of ANY kind will otherwise be guaranteed NOT DOA! Confirm compatibility with service provider before purchase.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Time Warner Cable, Cox Communication and more!
Designed to meet DOCSIS 3.0 specifications as well as backward compatibility with existing DOCSIS 2.0, 1.1 and 1.0 networks.
10/100/1000 Mbps Ethernet port to connect with router or computer; Form Factor: External
DOCSIS 3.0 Certified with speeds capable of up to 343Mbps down and 120Mbps upstream.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars918 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
